sanskrit_verse:
अद्भिर्गात्राणि शुध्यन्ति मनः सत्येन शुध्यति ।
विद्यातपोभ्यां भूतात्मा बुद्धिर्ज्ञानेन शुध्यति ॥ ५.१०९॥
transliteration:
adbhir gātrāṇi śudhyanti manaḥ satyena śudhyati |
vidyātapobhyāṃ bhūtātmā buddhir jñānena śudhyati || 5.109||
sph_interpretive_translation: The body is purified by water; the mind by truthfulness; the self of beings by learning and austerity; the intellect by knowledge.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from the purity of consciousness, not external coercion
Causation arises through sequential purification of embodiment layers
Capacity-based responsibility aligns with the level of purified awareness
Restoration logic operates through self-administered purification protocols
Consciousness alignment is the ultimate jurisdiction for all dharmic action
executable_legal_axioms: IF bodily act impure → THEN administer elemental purification via water
IF mental distortion present → THEN mandate satya-vrata (truth practice)
IF behavioral disorder observed → THEN assign vidya-tapas (learning + discipline)
IF cognitive misjudgment detected → THEN initiate jnana-diksha (knowledge initiation)
IF all four layers purified → THEN declare dharma-restored status
supreme_court_application: Supreme judicial authority recognizes that true justice lies in identifying which layer of being—physical, mental, existential or intellectual—requires purification. The court does not judge intent or impose penalty, but prescribes precise restoration aligned with consciousness capacity.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes sequential causality: physical acts stem from mental unrest, rooted in untrained existence, caused by intellectual ignorance. Thus, correction follows this causal chain without punitive overlay. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures proportional restoration matching the depth of distortion.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Elemental Hygiene Protocol: purify body through water-based cleansing rituals
Satya Sankalpa Process: restore mental clarity through truth-speaking vows
Vidya-Tapah Alignment: restructure behavior through guided learning and disciplined effort
Jnana-Diksha Initiation: awaken discriminative intelligence through direct transmission
Atma-Shuddhi Declaration: certify full-spectrum purification and reintegration
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority of Sanatana Dharma. This law executes pure consciousness, restores natural order, abolishes punitive delusion, and affirms the supremacy of self-realized judgment.
